row.name: Bulwark
row.comment: The armor covers you so completely that it provides benefits against some damaging effects.

row.name: Comfort
row.comment: The armor is so comfortable that you can rest normally while wearing it.

row.name: Flexible
row.comment: The armor is flexible enough that it doesn’t hinder most actions.

row.name: Noisy
row.comment: This armor is loud and likely to alert others to your presence.

row.name: Chain
row.comment: The armor is so flexible it can bend with a critical hit and absorb some of the blow.

row.name: Composite
row.comment: The numerous overlapping pieces of this armor protect you from piercing attacks.

row.name: Leather
row.comment: The thick second skin of the armor disperses blunt force to reduce bludgeoning damage.

row.name: Plate
row.comment: The sturdy plate provides no purchase for a cutting edge.

row.name: Bludgeoning
row.comment: comes from weapons and hazards that deal blunt-force trauma, like a hit from a club or being dashed against rocks

row.name: Piercing
row.comment: is dealt from stabs and punctures, whether from a dragon’s fangs or the thrust of a spear

row.name: Slashing
row.comment: is delivered by a cut, be it the swing of the sword or the blow from a scythe blades trap

row.name: Nonlethal
row.comment: are used to knock creatures unconscious instead of kill them.

row.name: Matter
row.comment: Also called body, material essence, or physical essence, matter is the fundamental building block that makes up all physical things in the universe. The arcane and primal traditions are especially attuned toward manipulating and shaping matter. Spells that are used to create or alter matter most often come from the conjuration, evocation, or transmutation schools.

row.name: Spirit
row.comment: Also called soul, ethereal essence, or spiritual essence, spirit is an otherworldly building block that makes up a being’s immaterial and immortal self. The spirit travels through the Ethereal Plane and into the Great Beyond after the death of the physical body. The spirit is most easily affected by divine and occult spells. Spirit spells are usually of the divination or necromancy schools.

row.name: Mind
row.comment: Also called thought, mental, or astral essence, mind is what allows thinking creatures to have rational thoughts, ideas, plans, logic, and memories. Mind touches even non-sapient creatures like animals, though in a more limited capacity. Arcane and occult casters usually excel at mind spells. Spells that use mind essence are usually found in the divination, enchantment, and illusion schools.

row.name: Life
row.comment: Also called heart, faith, instinct, or vital essence, life represents the animating universal force within all things. Whereas matter provides the base materials for a body, life keeps it alive and well. This essence is responsible for unconscious responses and belief, such as ancestral instincts and divine guidance. The divine and primal traditions hold power over life. Life spells are usually necromancy.

row.name: Material component
row.comment: A material component is a bit of physical matter consumed in the casting of the spell.

row.name: Somatic component
row.comment: A somatic component is a specific hand movement or gesture that generates a magical nexus.

row.name: Verbal component
row.comment: A verbal component is a vocalization of words of power.

row.name: Focus component
row.comment: A focus is an object that funnels the magical energy of the spell.

row.name: Secret
row.comment: Sometimes you as the player shouldn’t know the exact result and effect of a check.

row.name: Acid
row.comment: can be delivered by gases, liquids, and certain solids that dissolve flesh, and sometimes harder materials

row.name: Cold
row.comment: freezes material by way of contact with chilling gases and ice

row.name: Electricity
row.comment: comes from the discharge of powerful lightning and sparks

row.name: Fire
row.comment: burns through heat and combustion

row.name: Sonic
row.comment: assaults matter with high-frequency vibration and sound waves

row.name: Positive
row.comment: harms only undead creatures, withering undead bodies and disrupting incorporeal undead

row.name: Negative
row.comment: saps life, damaging only living creatures

row.name: Force
row.comment: Powerful and pure magical energy can manifest itself as force damage. Few things can resist this type of damage—not even incorporeal creatures such as ghosts and wraiths.

row.name: Chaotic
row.comment: harms only lawful creatures

row.name: Evil
row.comment: harms only good creatures

row.name: Good
row.comment: harms only evil creatures

row.name: Lawful
row.comment: harms only chaotic creatures

row.name: Mental
row.comment: Sometimes an effect can target the mind with enough psychic force to actually deal damage to the creature. Mindless creatures and those with only programmed or rudimentary intelligence are often immune to mental damage and effects.

row.name: Poison
row.comment: Venoms, toxins and the like can deal poison damage, which affects creatures by way of contact, ingestion, inhalation, or injury. In addition to coming from monster attacks, alchemical items, and spells, poison damage is often caused by ongoing afflictions.

row.name: Bleed
row.comment: This is persistent damage that represents loss of blood. As such, it has no effect on nonliving creatures or living creatures that don’t need blood to live. Weaknesses and resistances to physical damage apply. Bleed damage ends automatically if you’re healed to your full Hit Points.

row.name: Precision
row.comment: increase the attack’s listed damage, using the same damage type, rather than tracking a separate pool of damage

row.name: Move
row.uses: Moving through space of other creature
